title: Reinforcement Learning

definitions.Markov decision process: A set of states s in S, a set of actions (per state) A, a model T(s,a,s'), a reward function R(s,a,s')

summary: The slide discusses Reinforcement Learning, focusing on the Markov decision process (MDP) which includes states, actions, a model, and a reward function. It also introduces a new twist in reinforcement learning where the reward function is unknown, necessitating the exploration of actions and states to learn.
